{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presented with blockade, nasal discharge, diplopia, facial swelling, blackish discharge from the nasal cavity with necrosis of nasal mucosa, facial skin, and palate. The elevated blood sugar and positive urinary ketones suggest a possible fungal infection. Considering the involvement of multiple sites including nose, face, and palate, Paracoccidioidis brasiliensis was suspected due to the description in Tapia's syndrome. Ketoconasol is mentioned as part of the treatment for this condition.", "answer_choice": C}
